textBeforeTable: ANDHRA PRADESH The following table gives you the list of approved Distance Education universities in India (as on 5 May, 2015):   We have prepared the list of approved Distance Education universities in India that follow a three-tier process; that of scanning institutional information comprising infrastructure, faculty, delivery system, student support system etc; visit to institutions by experts; and approval of programs evaluated for content, quality and self-instructional nature of the course. We have also enlisted 'Fake Universities' as per UGC, click here to check the list. While choosing the institute for distance education, you must keep in mind to select the approved ones. For that, having a list of approved Distance Education universities in India is necessary.   In accordance with the directions of the Central Government in December 2012, the responsibility of undertaking the regulatory functions of the Distance Education has been transferred from Distance Education Council (DEC) to University Grants Commission (UGC). Thus, UGC is the sole regulating body in the country for distance education and it has been granting approval to the institutes to offer courses that must follow certain standards and guidelines.   Distance learning institutes in India have witnessed a remarkable rise in student enrolment crossing the 10 million mark.
